title: Las Vegas Metropolian Police Press Policies

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Las Vegas Metropolian Police Press Policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy concerning press or media credentials (that is, who is eligible for applying for a press credential, the standards applied to applications, or what access or privileges are granted by a press credential).

2. A copy of any media distribution list currently used by the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department, including any email or mailing list.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Information Regarding Alejandro Luis Antunez de Mayolo Mendez (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all files related to Alejandro Luis Antunez de Mayolo Mendez and his son Alejandro Antunez de Mayolo. Alejandro Luis once served as the Chief of Staff to General Artemio Palomino Toledo as noted in a declassified Military Intelligence Summary (Volume VIII, Latin America) published by the DIA in 1986. In April 1992, Alejandro Luis's son, Alejandro Antunez de Mayolo, was assassinated by the shining path in an attempt to assassinate Alejandro: https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1992-04-10-mn-194-story.html. Given that Alejandro Luis Antunez de Mayolo passed away on January 9, 2024 (attached is a photo of the announcement that was printed in El Comercio), releasing this information should not have any personal impact on Alejandro Luis or Alejandro.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alonso ADM

title: FBI files: Kinky Friedman

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI files: Kinky Friedman
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request an electronic copy of all FBI files on Kinky Friedman, a musician and politician who died in June 2024. This is his obituary: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/27/arts/music/kinky-friedman-dead.html

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Anime FOIPA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Anime FOIPA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records pertaining to the import, sale, and distribution of “anime” in the United States of America. Anime can be defined as cartoons or animations that are of Japanese origin.

If any information is exempt, please cite exemptions where necessary.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Pasteris

title: Herman Paul Pressler III (June 4, 1930 – June 7, 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Herman Paul Pressler III (June 4, 1930 – June 7, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former judge and Southern Baptist Convention leader Herman Paul Pressler III (June 4, 1930 – June 7, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/16/obituaries/paul-pressler-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am limiting my request to the free two hours of searching and 100 duplicated
pages. I am not willing to pay additional fees.

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation
    or inquiry into founding Black Studies academic Nathaniel Hare (April 9,
    1933 â€“ June 10, 2024), also known as Nathan. His death is widely-known and
    widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are
    voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find
    his New York Times obituary at the following link:
    https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/21/obituaries/nathan-hare-dead.html
    
    Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not
    limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone
    Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and
    the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and
    cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant
    names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not
    limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a
    cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any
    information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to
    137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released
    records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those
    records while additional records are located and processed for release.
    
    If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to
    review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of
    responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.
    
    I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an
    assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on
    topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible
    Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the
    Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial
    capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Matthew Petti

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Email sent to Judge PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from Kevin Riford regarding Christina Little

The Riford Family

title: Government Employee Salary Data (Department of Public Instruction)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Government Employee Salary Data (Department of Public Instruction)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the most recent database maintained by this agency detailing government employee compensation across the state.

I am specifically requesting that this release include, for each State employee, the following: Name of Employee, Age, Gender, Ethnicity, Job Title, Agency/department, City/location in which employee is stationed, and Earnings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sam

title: San Jose Cease and Desist

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: San Jose Cease and Desist
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Administrative Nuisance Abatement as described in Chapter 1.13 of the city code.

Please provide any and all nuisance abatement cease and desist orders (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) from January 1, 2024 to the date this request is filed. This should include documents used to determine whether the property is considered a nuisance. 


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

Dear Adam Steinbaugh,
 
I am writing to update you as to the status of your records request.  
 
We have identified a body-worn camera video record(s) responsive to your request. The identified record(s) contains exempt information and requires video redaction. You have not self-identified as a person who is exempt from redaction cost as provided in RCW 42.56.240(14)(e)(i). As a result, the City of Edmonds is allowed to charge you the reasonable costs related to redacting the body worn video you have requested.

An invoice outlining the estimated cost to process your request has been prepared and uploaded into your account. These costs are only estimates and may vary depending on the actual time it takes to complete your request; actual charges may increase or decrease. Redaction costs are $0.77 per minute of redaction time. A non-refundable 10% deposit of the estimated cost is required prior to processing the request for body-worn camera videos.

Payment can be made online on your account, over the phone or in person during business hours between Monday-Friday 8:30am – 4:30pm. To contact our records department for payment, please call 425-771-0200.

Checks or money order must be made payable to The City of Edmonds and mailed to:

Edmonds Police Department
Attn: Public Disclosure
250 5th Ave N.
Edmonds, WA 98020
 
If we do not receive the 10% deposit within 10 calendar days, we will consider your request for bodycam footage closed.  

If you wish to modify your request for bodycam, or narrow the scope of your request, please contact us and we are happy to work with you.
 
All other responsive records have been uploaded to Police Department’s Records Porta. Please log into your account to review and download records.  
 
If you have any questions or have any difficulty in accessing the records, please do not hesitate to respond to this email, or call me at 425-275-4522.  
 
Thank you,

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Missouri camping ban correspondence
communications.communication:
Ms. Burns, I am responding to your request for records dated June 25, 2024. The House of Representatives is not the custodian of records of individual representatives. The Missouri Constitution, Article III, Section 19, states that “Each member of the general assembly is the custodian of legislative records under the custody and control of the member, their employees and staff.”

The House does not retain the email reocords of former representatives McDaniel or DeGroot. For current representatives McGaugh and Burger, you may wish to contact the representative’s office directly for assistance; the contact information may be found here: https://house.mo.gov/MemberRoster.aspx

Thank you,

Bryan D. Scheiderer
General Counsel
Missouri House of Representatives
(573) 522-2639

title: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (Bel Air Police Department)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (Bel Air Police Department)
Online Form Submittal: Maryland Public Information Act Request Form
communications.communication:
The following form was submitted via your website: Maryland Public Information Act Request Form


Date: 06/27/2024

First Name: Deborah

Last Name: Levi

Address 1: MuckRock News, DEPT MR166111

Address 2: 263 Huntington Ave

City: Boston

State: Massachusetts

Zip Code: 02115

Phone: 617-299-1832

Email: 166111-15181337@requests.muckrock.com

List the requested public records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records for every sworn officer and civilian member of the Bel Air Police Department for fiscal year 2023 and fiscal year 2024:

1. First and last name;
2. Unique sequence number;
3. Race;
4. Gender;
5. Hire date;
6. 2023 salary;
7. 2023 overtime;
8. 2024 salary;
9. 2024 overtime.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Alternatively, please consider waiving any fees, pursuant to § 4-206(e)(2)(ii) of the General Provisions Article, as this request is on behalf of individuals served by the Maryland Office of the Public Defender, a state government agency, which solely serves indigent citizens of Maryland. As a result, my request for the above-listed public records is in the public interest. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Deborah Levi
Director of Special Litigation
Maryland Office of the Public Defender
(443) 272-1068

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpolice-department-28174%252Frequest-for-your-agencys-2023-2024-roster-salary-data-bel-air-police-department-166111%252F%253Femail%253Dmkrantz%252540belairmd.org&url_auth_token=AAGU9iPxojIiyrREU_fiNaM6p9Y%3A1sMg7l%3AbzMp9lf-j1eXXXpT5Wpk2TpEjQVfZcOHrtyLbOo72Ds



Additional Information:
